str2: And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.
Or neuter pleion, or pleon comparative of polus; more in quantity, number, or quality; also the major portion.
(a) of two: another, a second, (b) other, different, (c) one's neighbor. Of uncertain affinity; other or different.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To give solemn evidence, testify (declare) solemnly. From dia and martureo; to attest or protest earnestly, or hortatively.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To save, heal, preserve, rescue. From a primary sos; to save, i.e. Deliver or protect.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Crooked, perverse, unfair, curved, tortuous. From the base of skelos; warped, i.e. Winding; figuratively, perverse.
From genos; a generation; by implication, an age.
